website_summaries.verdict: Can create multiple pitches with this mouth whistle for different breeds.
pros: No hands are required to use this whistle, as it fits in the mouth
You can use your tongue to produce a variety of pitches
Trusted style of whistle used by dog trainers for many years
cons: Some users find it too complicated

customer_reviews.title: Needs practice, but it’s a very versatile whistle
customer_reviews.text: My, what an unusual whistle — not for the novice! I got it out of curiosity. I’m not a shepherd, and I have no dog, so I have no idea how it’s SUPPOSED to be used. That said, it comes with no instructions, but the guidance at acme.co.uk is enough to get you making noise within a half hour. After that, you’re constrained only by the dexterity of your imagination and your tongue. I can’t say how dogs respond to it, but I can whistle “My Country ‘Tis of Thee” (GSTQ) Dogs aside, I think this could be useful in a noisy environment where you need to signal more expressively than the usual fixed pitch whistle affords.
customer_reviews.author: A Curmudgeon in Brookeville

customer_reviews.title: Takes time to learn but worth the effort
customer_reviews.text: This takes time to learn how to use well. It didn't take long to get a single tone, but it did take time to build a consistent range of tones, control, and consistency. It might be easier for someone who already knows how to whistle, but I didn't so I was starting from scratch. I watched YouTube videos on how to use it but they didn't really help at all. In the end I just had to keep working with it until I figured it out. The effort was well worth it because the range of tones allows for a wide variety of cues for your dog and at a good distance.
customer_reviews.author: Adriane

customer_reviews.title: This is fun...and loud!
customer_reviews.text: I've been having fun learning how to use the shepherd's whistle. If you go on YouTube you can find videos on it. It's fun to learn how to use it, and it does take some time getting used to it, but I can almost play Mary Had A Little Lamb! Can't wait to use it with my dogs to see how they will respond. Right now I work with it in the car while driving to learn how to use it. Would suggest you connect a lanyard, or something, on it since it doesn't seem safe in your mouth just by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Talley Novotny

customer_reviews.title: It is constructed of thin sheet metal and bends easily. The design does not work well and a ...
customer_reviews.text: This whistle is not for the herder. It is constructed of thin sheet metal and bends easily. The design does not work well and a total waste of time in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Winegar

customer_reviews.title: so so.  not great
customer_reviews.text: Needs to be bent a little to work. Not as loud as the cheaper plastic ones. It aort of works. For the record, I can whistle Dixie on my 20 year old plastic one easily, or other complex tunes. This one isn't very good. Will order the brass one that is a clone of the plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron J Myers

customer_reviews.title: Decent whistle.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool. I would have given it 5 stars, but it has a dirty oily taste when playing it for the first month or so. It appears that the steel cutout has a sort of rivet that has grease trapped in the tiny crevice. Aside from that, the nickel coating is extremely thin... it does however play great and allows for multiple dog commands. From whistling to playing notes akin to a clarinet. Once you have enough experience to play it, it's wonderful. I wouldn't recommend YouTube for learning to play this. It's full of amateurs. The best way to learn is by jamming this thing in your mouth and trial and error.
customer_reviews.author: Vigilant Lance

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: Zero instructions come with this thing. If you already know how to use one, I'm sure it works great. If you don't (like me), then good luck. The entirety of instructions I found anywhere online for these was, "Put it in your mouth. Use it to whistle," which does not work except to make occasional strangled bird noises. I abandoned the effort and just used my time to learn to whistle without it. Waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: ItenerantMonk

customer_reviews.title: Best whistle out there
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a number of these over the years, I keep misplacing them along with my damned glasses. They are very loud and once you get the hang of it you can provide a lot of variance in the sound, tone, affectation, etc for different commands. My dogs range on hikes and this is a great way to bring them back into sight and give that piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: SStrout

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Needs practice. Get for multiple commands not just recall.
customer_reviews.text: Works great and very loud. If you want a few commands you can do quickly this is perfect. If you just want a recall whistle get a normal one. This dose need practice. I learned a basic whistle quickly tho.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D

customer_reviews.title: It makes plenty of noise!
customer_reviews.text: This Whistle is exactly as represented. It is a bit difficult to learn but does the job once you get past that.The quality is excellent. Due to it being shipped separately from the other items I ordered I paid more for the shipping than I did for the whistle. That was a bit of a disappointment hence the 4 star rating instead of 5. Thanks for a very high quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Squeaker

customer_reviews.title: Simple and very cool
customer_reviews.text: a few you tube videos and a little practice in the car and I can make all kinds of sounds. I also got a plastic whistle but the stainless one is much easier to make sound with for me. I don't notice any off putting taste as others have mentioned
customer_reviews.author: HappyCat

customer_reviews.title: Great recall whistle. Bring puppy home.
customer_reviews.text: This whistle was a little tricky to learn how to blow, but even when my sounds were weak while learning, my dog responded amazingly. Now that I can make a clean whistle sound, my dog is nothing less than zippity to come to me even when his attention is focused elsewhere. Strong, clear, long reaching sound. Great whistle.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Baker

customer_reviews.title: Gets attention despite distractions
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out how to use this whistle, I loved it! You just have to wrap your lips around the edge and you can get the tone you want with your tongue. It gets my pups attention every time so I can give a command despite the distractions.
customer_reviews.author: Usedtobeapunkcory

customer_reviews.title: Perfect whistle, works exactly as needed
customer_reviews.text: This whistle definitely worked exactly as it was supposed to. You really need to read up on the training of Shepherds/Cattle Dogs, so you know how to use this appropriately. But once you do, this whistle works just as needed. It is compact and can fit in a pocket, which is perfect when you are outside working. It also has a hole to be able to string it through a string to wear around your neck as needed. Perfect whistle in a good material.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Sharpe

customer_reviews.title: Classic whistle but takes skill!
customer_reviews.text: Believe the people that say they never got a usable tone. Better just use an ultrasonic or salsa whistle. After a while I could get a tone out of it but that's about all. I admit I am a lousy mouth whistler too, so there may be a correlation.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: These whistles are a learning curve. This whistle was bigger than other Whistles I have purchased. That is what I didn’t like.
customer_reviews.author: Launa

customer_reviews.title: Be patient!
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps the three is a bit harsh, and it's just my lack of musicality showing. I'm still working on a second note. Beautifully made, with a nice heft, but a lot more difficult than my Bosun's Pipe.
customer_reviews.author: Homohabilis

customer_reviews.title: Hard to learn but worth the effort
customer_reviews.text: It took a little while to learn to make the correct mouth movements required to make the whistle work. There are a couple good videos on YouTube. Stick with it and you will make it work.
customer_reviews.author: K0PIE

customer_reviews.title: Works great once learned
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a learning curve as to the pitch variations. Solid piece of metal will last more than a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Its pretty-good.
customer_reviews.text: It works ok, a little harder to use than my old whistle. A little harder to learn. For a newly made product, its good quality, if you can't find an old one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs skill to use but is a great whistle.
customer_reviews.text: Just looks, feels, and tastes good. I could not pick this up right away and whistle very well, there is a level of skill needed.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Revelle

customer_reviews.title: I can actually make this one whistle. Had such ...
customer_reviews.text: I can actually make this one whistle. Had such a hard time with other brands to get anything but air sounds. This one actually whistles. Now I just have to learn how to control the tones.
customer_reviews.author: Paul-Gee

customer_reviews.title: Don't give up on it once you get the hang of it it's very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I found this a very helpful tool in training my dog. It takes a little time to learn how to use it but was well worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to master.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve yet to acquire the ability to blow this whistle, instructional videos are not much help since the action is in your mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So much FUN!!! I can't whistle worth a crap. But with this Shephard whistle, I can! Got it to train my dogs. Takes a little bit of practice and time to figure out how to use it. But once you do, it's loud and works great!!
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Well designed, and built.
customer_reviews.text: A fascinating whistle from an age old tradition that is able to control your dog in various circumstances. Besides working with my pooch, I find it fascinating to learn, and play, with certainly musical qualities. (Obviously, a dog loving musician...) Great product, great Seller, great service!
customer_reviews.author: David Spicer

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother with the plastic version. For me, ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother with the plastic version. For me, bought two previous plastic, they both broke and I used for hours. This doesn't seem to suffer that wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: BRT dog ownedTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It’s made with nickel silver
customer_reviews.text: I figured it out easy but Then I also saw that it was Nickel Silver. Great pipe but not good for nickel allergic people
customer_reviews.author: victoria s.yunker

customer_reviews.title: Love the metal
customer_reviews.text: Had a hard time finding one made of metal, works great. I prefer the plastic in cold weather, but the metal makes a better sound.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Fun

customer_reviews.title: Takes a while to learn how to use it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a friend. It’s not as easy to use properly as you might think. He’s still practicing.
customer_reviews.author: Tomfooter

customer_reviews.title: Difficult
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use it to train my dog. I could never get the knack of it.
customer_reviews.author: irmgard kimmerly

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Too cheap to get the correct whistle sound. Definitely invest in a good one
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Adams

customer_reviews.title: Be patient
customer_reviews.text: Just this whistle today. After about 5 minutes I could hit a couple pitches. This is a product that will take lots of practice to master. I love it. Quality is simple but good. Get one and have some fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Learning how to use it. It's fun. Fast delivery and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: CWY

customer_reviews.title: Once I figure out how to really use it...
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to use for my dog who isn't the greatest listener when he is busy playing because I saw someone with one and they really work well. Even my dog came running! Once you figure out how to blow into them correctly, I'm working on that...the quality seems good and I'd much rather have stainless steel than plastic in my mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Lainee

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be just as expected
customer_reviews.text: My husband got this, no he is trying to call the dogs with it?! So far he hasnt mastered it, i am the only one that hears it. Grrr
customer_reviews.author: Carla Reinke

customer_reviews.title: I like it but very hard to learn how to use
customer_reviews.text: I like it but very hard to learn how to use, my dogs respond to the plastic Acme whistle better & I can make more noise with it. I am still trying to learn how to use it, though. I do not have a problem with the taste at all.
customer_reviews.author: blue dog arts

customer_reviews.title: Great whistle after you learn how to use it!
customer_reviews.text: It took awhile to learn how to use this...YouTube has some good teaching videos. The whistle makes our dog turn immediately and head back to us. LOL, at the dog park it seems to attract each and every dog!!
customer_reviews.author: DucksTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Needs more explanation
customer_reviews.text: Wish they had video how to use learning to use it is difficult
customer_reviews.author: Greg Mowery

customer_reviews.title: Perfect whistle!
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy the plastic ones, so I thought I would try a metal whistle. Love it, just clean it off with non toxic wash before your first use. Mine had some type of coating, that didn't task good.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Stricklett

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special, just what it is.
customer_reviews.text: On a windy day, 100 yards is to far to yell. This is a nice quality standard, maybe slightly larger than standard, shepherd's whistle. Whether you're a shepherd or not, you can appreciate a whistle like this when your dog's head pops up at the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Sanson Corrasco

customer_reviews.title: Dogs delight
customer_reviews.text: High pitch, great whistle, dogs really attentive to this one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Aussie loves
customer_reviews.text: My Aussie pup loves the sound and comes to see what it is, so yes happy.
customer_reviews.author: Ishkey

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Whiste!
customer_reviews.text: JUST know if you haven't used this kind of whistle before instructions are necessary to proper use. Instructions need to be looked up though. I first thought this was a silent whistle. I took a long walk and I was really impressed with the very loud sounds I was making. So we're the neighbourhood dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Takes a minute to learn
customer_reviews.text: Took a half a day to learn how to get to using it. I had to bend a little to get full range. Be careful not to over bend
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound
customer_reviews.text: Takes a bit to learn, but it is sturdy and classic in design. Teaching the pup to come and deploy based on sound.
customer_reviews.author: J.N.Y.

customer_reviews.title: Just a whistle that will work...
customer_reviews.text: I figured out how to blow this whistle right away, but it will take practice to play specific note reliably. It does taste quite metallic to me, but not so much that I won't use it. I may have it gold plated to remove taste.
customer_reviews.author: DoMinator

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as listed, it does have a learning curve as others have stated. It's not too bad to learn though as many youtubers out there are more than helpful. Within about 4-5 days I had this whistle down for the most part. Recommend this to all dog trainers and owners alike.
customer_reviews.author: Thruascope

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I've tried to use it as have other people in my family and it just doesn't work
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: but the whistle is great.. no problems with taste as indicated by ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't learned to be consistent with it yet, but the whistle is great..no problems with taste as indicated by others.
customer_reviews.author: betty

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Does not work as well as the shepherds whistle I got in New Zealand.
customer_reviews.author: JWolf

customer_reviews.title: Practice practice practice again
customer_reviews.text: Pfffffffffff.........fits comfortably in my mouth, since buying it coming something sounds. That is, practice, practice practice again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: There is a bit of a learning curve, and it doesn't come with instructions, but I played with this for an afternoon and watched a couple of You Tube videos, and figured it out. One piece of advice worth considering from a more experienced user is to get proficient with this before you start training your dog to it, otherwise you both will get frustrated. Can't wait to start training, but I need some more practice first.
customer_reviews.author: N. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Fun but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: It's quite expensive for a small bent piece of sheet metal. It is only the second example I've found of a use for a hole tone device for whistling. With a little practice I could make sounds and after a while even play tunes. Best not to practice with your friends around!
customer_reviews.author: QY

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Whistle works but it would have been better if instructions were included.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Ok for beginning practice but not competition.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t have the heft or tone of other, especially brass whistles.
customer_reviews.author: john h wheaton

customer_reviews.title: practice, practice, practice
customer_reviews.text: Has a metallic taste that does go away. It does take work and practice to get the hang of it. But it has a large range on tones.
customer_reviews.author: JumpNThoroughbred

customer_reviews.title: but I like it. It is nice and loud and my ...
customer_reviews.text: A little tricky to learn to use, but I like it. It is nice and loud and my dogs pay attention. Gonna take some practice though..
customer_reviews.author: peteyfoozer

customer_reviews.title: Small and compact
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little to get used too. I wish it had instructions
customer_reviews.author: Robin H. Wallingford

customer_reviews.title: Great product, quick delivery!
customer_reviews.text: This is just cool! It was a super fast delivery and it worked great. I even had to pick up a second one as my grand daughter has now claimed my first one! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Great whistle
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to get sound - must refine with practice
customer_reviews.author: Connee

customer_reviews.title: Not easy
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to use. I showed it to a long time herding person and she agreed, said it is notoriously hard.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam E. Harthill

customer_reviews.title: Shepherd Mouth Whistle - Nickel Silver
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. I had it working in no time but had been practicing with a plastic one for a while and found that I could use the metal a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Shepherd Mouth Whistle
customer_reviews.text: The Acme shepherd mouth whistle is a high quality piece made in England of stainless steel. Unlike many things of the same material it is substantial enough to last a lifetime without bending, while light and easy to handle. For those who don't know, this is not a traditional athletic type whistle. It may take some practice to become proficient with it, but instructions are included. With a little practice anybody can produce a variety of whistles from this quality piece.
customer_reviews.author: linda33

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, durable
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the plastic ones and more durable. With two English Shepherds, a Great Pyrenees and a Sheltie, mine stays in my pocket all day. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Payne

customer_reviews.title: Not the whistle for me
customer_reviews.text: Is too hard to master, never could get a good whistle sound from it. I know it works, I've seen people use them, just not so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Shane R.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Profile is too large for my large mouth for comfortable use.
customer_reviews.author: Donald D Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: a good whistle
customer_reviews.text: this is better than the whistles I got in the north of England 20 years ago. My plastic one finally broke, and my old metal one could not be worn on a string or necklace as this one can.
customer_reviews.author: mary.cowmeadow

customer_reviews.title: Machine Oil on Product
customer_reviews.text: The whistle is fine, but it came with a lot of machine oil smeared on the inside. Not something I want to stick in my mouth!
customer_reviews.author: ethan nonomura

customer_reviews.title: A Little wide
customer_reviews.text: This is okay for a whistle but unless you have a really big mouth you may have to cut it down some. The first day I tried it and had sores on each side from the width.
customer_reviews.author: Gooseberry

customer_reviews.title: Neat Whistle
customer_reviews.text: Still in the learning process on how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got the metal one
customer_reviews.text: I have a plastic one and have been having trouble trying to get a consistent sound out of it but the metal one is so much easier to use I can get it to whistle every time with just the right sound that I mean to make.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Clark

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great little whistle, well made and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Puppy Winston LOVES it (I do too)
customer_reviews.text: My working border collie puppy responds!!! It's innate! Definitely a must have for anyone with a herding breed.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto_el_Gato

customer_reviews.title: I've used this type of whistle for over 20 years ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this type of whistle for over 20 years. For some reason this particular pattern is rather difficult to use and does not have the range tonal & distance of the less elaborate ones (steel not plastic) made in NZ. Chalk one up for the Kiwis! I'm an Australian, resident in Poland.
customer_reviews.author: GRM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect with practice
customer_reviews.text: It takes some practice but once you know how to use one of these, They're great. And my dog is very responsive to the sound of it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Bicking

customer_reviews.title: Blaster
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the hang of using this whistle it is a lot of fun. EXTREMELY LOUD. Very well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Blanco

customer_reviews.title: Cheap bent piece of metal.
customer_reviews.text: Mine as well make it out of a soda can.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Tough to get it to whistle
customer_reviews.text: It is well made , but I had this about 2 weeks and still have not been able to make it whistle very much at all.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Is hard to master. My wife never couldn't and threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: The General

customer_reviews.title: Best Dog Whistle in existence
customer_reviews.text: Once I got the hang of this one, I can get some Crazy pitches out of this one more easily than the traditional. I have every Dog whistle available, to include the Megaphone style. This is the loudest and the different tones I can control the dogs, left, right, etc. this one is far better than any other. This one is so good it could have good Military applications!
customer_reviews.author: Randy,

customer_reviews.title: Nice whistle, steep learning curve
customer_reviews.text: Making a sound worthy of dog control is no easy feat with this piece of metal. There is a long, steep learning curve. However, with persistence and practice you can learn to control the sound of this whistle and you'll never want to use a "normal" whistle ever again. Be patient, keep at it and watch your loyal companion obey your every whim.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Whistle,
customer_reviews.text: Came quickly and was just as advertised. It takes a while to learn to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ross M T

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it! Quality is great. Thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: Melisa Heckathorn

customer_reviews.title: Like it!
customer_reviews.text: Got to get better at using it as I need different pitches for the dogs to recognize the commands given.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Youren

customer_reviews.title: Its hard to use at first, but once you ...
customer_reviews.text: Its hard to use at first, but once you start fiddling with it, and get it, it gives a very loud, clear sound.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: A new whistle-nice clear tone
customer_reviews.text: Similar to whistles I have bought in the past. It does have a different tone and I find it a mite more difficult to blow, probably because it is curved on the part next to the back of the tongue. I am looking forward to use it in a couple of days in a training situation. Bendable, so it is a wee bit more fragile than the stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: P Pedersen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Tricky to learn to use, but it does work and work well!
customer_reviews.author: Tom M

customer_reviews.title: Long learning ccurve/
customer_reviews.text: It was very difficult to learn to use. Would be helpful to have an instruction book. However the price was OK.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Uhlik

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness
customer_reviews.text: Thank you so much! My dog and me are putting it to good use. Excellent seller!
customer_reviews.author: Samzirra

customer_reviews.title: directions unclear
customer_reviews.text: directions were unclear. went on line to find out how to use the whistle. price was good! quality was good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Taras

customer_reviews.title: If I could figure out how to use it...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I'm doing with this thing. It's good quality... I think. Unless the quality is why it won't whistle for me? Nah.. probably has more to do with me doing it wrong. ha worst review ever, I know.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: It's tricky but not impossible and there are a great many videos on how to use it
customer_reviews.text: I need to practice but actually got this working after only a few tries. It's tricky but not impossible and there are a great many videos on how to use it. Now if I could get my dog to do what she's supposed to be doing we'll be all set. She's just a puppy yet but coming along.
customer_reviews.author: Beverley Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get consistant
customer_reviews.text: But that should be known since it's human error and not the whistle's fault...with much practice i was able to get consistent but like recommended....practice to and from work inside your car. It's been great messing with dogs in other vehicles though :)
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Felix

customer_reviews.title: DIFFICULT to use this whistle
customer_reviews.text: It is extremely hard to learn to blow this whistle-even using the tutorials. Perhaps if you have experience with playing a reed or wind instrument, it might be easier. Otherwise--it is amazing to listen to what the whistle can do IF you are capable of blowing it successfully ! Maybe if I'd grown up in Scotland- I'd have had earlier exposure to using this whistle.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia B.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's easier to use a whistle with a pea in it.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Sound carries well. Animals pay attention to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Shepherd mouth whistle
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize the entire thing goes in my mouth. Not good on very cold days as you may imagine. The product seems very well made and does emit a shrill whistle but I have found a different whistle to serve my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: My dog responded right off the bat. I love this whistle. It definitely requires some work but if you are wondering how it works watch this you-tube video [...]
customer_reviews.author: H. M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Loud!
customer_reviews.text: Works better than the plastic ones....it is louder ,or perhaps "shriller"(is that a word?) Well made. Should last awhile. Tastes a little like metal; YMMV, but if you have fillings, may not be for you?!?!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Olivo

product_meta.title: Shepherd Mouth Whistle - Nickel Silver
product_meta.description: Sometimes called the Shepherd’s Lip Whistle made famous by the television program, One Man and His Dog. This professional model enables the dog trainer to create a crescendo of sound in tremendous variety. There are many dog trainers who consider this to be the ultimate in-tune communication with your dog. Nickel Silver.
feature_bullets: Insert in the mouth and manipulate with the tongue
Produces a widely varying and easy controlled range of pitches
